Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: webpack

Arguments.Name: --config
Arguments.Description: Provide path to a webpack configuration file e.g. ./webpack.config.js

Arguments.Name: --config-name
Arguments.Description: Name of the configuration to use

Arguments.Name: --merge
Arguments.Description: Merge two or more configurations using 'webpack-merge'

Arguments.Name: --env
Arguments.Description: Environment passed to the configuration when it is a function

Arguments.Name: --node-env
Arguments.Description: Sets process.env.NODE_ENV to the specified value

Arguments.Name: --analyze
Arguments.Description: It invokes webpack-bundle-analyzer plugin to get bundle information

Arguments.Name: --json
Arguments.Description: Prints result as JSON or store it in a file

Arguments.Name: --bail
Arguments.Description: Report the first error as a hard error instead of tolerating it

Arguments.Name: --cache
Arguments.Description: Enable in memory caching. Disable caching

Arguments.Name: --cache-cache-unaffected
Arguments.Description: Additionally cache computation of modules that are unchanged and reference only unchanged modules

Arguments.Name: --cache-max-generations
Arguments.Description: Number of generations unused cache entries stay in memory cache at minimum (1 = may be removed after unused for a single compilation, ..., Infinity: kept forever)

Arguments.Name: --cache-allow-collecting-memory
Arguments.Description: Allows to collect unused memory allocated during deserialization. This requires copying data into smaller buffers and has a performance cost

Arguments.Name: --cache-cache-directory
Arguments.Description: Base directory for the cache (defaults to node_modules/.cache/webpack)

Arguments.Name: --cache-cache-location
Arguments.Description: Locations for the cache (defaults to cacheDirectory / name)

Arguments.Name: --cache-compression
Arguments.Description: Compression type used for the cache files

Arguments.Name: --cache-hash-algorithm
Arguments.Description: Algorithm used for generation the hash (see node.js crypto package)

Arguments.Name: --cache-idle-timeout
Arguments.Description: Time in ms after which idle period the cache storing should happen

Arguments.Name: --cache-idle-timeout-after-large-changes
Arguments.Description: Time in ms after which idle period the cache storing should happen when larger changes has been detected (cumulative build time > 2 x avg cache store time)

Arguments.Name: --cache-idle-timeout-for-initial-store
Arguments.Description: Time in ms after which idle period the initial cache storing should happen

Arguments.Name: --cache-immutable-paths
Arguments.Description: A RegExp matching an immutable directory (usually a package manager cache directory, including the tailing slash) A path to an immutable directory (usually a package manager cache directory)

Arguments.Name: --cache-immutable-paths-reset
Arguments.Description: Clear all items provided in 'cache.immutablePaths' configuration. List of paths that are managed by a package manager and contain a version or hash in its path so all files are immutable

Arguments.Name: --cache-managed-paths
Arguments.Description: A RegExp matching a managed directory (usually a node_modules directory, including the tailing slash) A path to a managed directory (usually a node_modules directory)

Arguments.Name: --cache-managed-paths-reset
Arguments.Description: Clear all items provided in 'cache.managedPaths' configuration. List of paths that are managed by a package manager and can be trusted to not be modified otherwise

Arguments.Name: --cache-max-age
Arguments.Description: Time for which unused cache entries stay in the filesystem cache at minimum (in milliseconds)

Arguments.Name: --cache-max-memory-generations
Arguments.Description: Number of generations unused cache entries stay in memory cache at minimum (0 = no memory cache used, 1 = may be removed after unused for a single compilation, ..., Infinity: kept forever). Cache entries will be deserialized from disk when removed from memory cache

Arguments.Name: --cache-memory-cache-unaffected
Arguments.Description: Additionally cache computation of modules that are unchanged and reference only unchanged modules in memory

Arguments.Name: --cache-name
Arguments.Description: Name for the cache. Different names will lead to different coexisting caches

Arguments.Name: --cache-profile
Arguments.Description: Track and log detailed timing information for individual cache items

Arguments.Name: --cache-store
Arguments.Description: When to store data to the filesystem. (pack: Store data when compiler is idle in a single file)

Arguments.Name: --cache-version
Arguments.Description: Version of the cache data. Different versions won't allow to reuse the cache and override existing content. Update the version when config changed in a way which doesn't allow to reuse cache. This will invalidate the cache

Arguments.Name: --context
Arguments.Description: The base directory (absolute path!) for resolving the `entry` option. If `output.pathinfo` is set, the included pathinfo is shortened to this directory

Arguments.Name: --dependencies
Arguments.Description: References to another configuration to depend on

Arguments.Name: --dependencies-reset
Arguments.Description: Clear all items provided in 'dependencies' configuration. References to other configurations to depend on

Arguments.Name: --entry
Arguments.Description: The entry point(s) of your application e.g. ./src/main.js

Arguments.Name: --entry-reset
Arguments.Description: Clear all items provided in 'entry' configuration. All modules are loaded upon startup. The last one is exported

Arguments.Name: --experiments-async-web-assembly
Arguments.Description: Support WebAssembly as asynchronous EcmaScript Module

Arguments.Name: --experiments-back-compat
Arguments.Description: Enable backward-compat layer with deprecation warnings for many webpack 4 APIs

Arguments.Name: --experiments-build-http-allowed-uris
Arguments.Description: Allowed URI pattern. Allowed URI (resp. the beginning of it)

Arguments.Name: --experiments-build-http-allowed-uris-reset
Arguments.Description: Clear all items provided in 'experiments.buildHttp.allowedUris' configuration. List of allowed URIs (resp. the beginning of them)

Arguments.Name: --experiments-build-http-cache-location
Arguments.Description: Location where resource content is stored for lockfile entries. It's also possible to disable storing by passing false

Arguments.Name: --experiments-build-http-frozen
Arguments.Description: When set, anything that would lead to a modification of the lockfile or any resource content, will result in an error

Arguments.Name: --experiments-build-http-proxy
Arguments.Description: Proxy configuration, which can be used to specify a proxy server to use for HTTP requests

Arguments.Name: --experiments-build-http-upgrade
Arguments.Description: When set, resources of existing lockfile entries will be fetched and entries will be upgraded when resource content has changed

Arguments.Name: --experiments-cache-unaffected
Arguments.Description: Enable additional in memory caching of modules that are unchanged and reference only unchanged modules

Arguments.Name: --experiments-css-exports-only
Arguments.Description: Avoid generating and loading a stylesheet and only embed exports from css into output javascript files

Arguments.Name: --experiments-future-defaults
Arguments.Description: Apply defaults of next major version

Arguments.Name: --experiments-lazy-compilation
Arguments.Description: Compile entrypoints and import()s only when they are accessed

Arguments.Name: --experiments-lazy-compilation-backend-protocol
Arguments.Description: Specifies the protocol the client should use to connect to the server

Arguments.Name: --experiments-lazy-compilation-imports
Arguments.Description: Enable/disable lazy compilation for import() modules

Arguments.Name: --experiments-lazy-compilation-test
Arguments.Description: Specify which entrypoints or import()ed modules should be lazily compiled. This is matched with the imported module and not the entrypoint name

Arguments.Name: --experiments-output-module
Arguments.Description: Allow output javascript files as module source type

Arguments.Name: --experiments-sync-web-assembly
Arguments.Description: Support WebAssembly as synchronous EcmaScript Module (outdated)

Arguments.Name: --experiments-top-level-await
Arguments.Description: Allow using top-level-await in EcmaScript Modules

Arguments.Name: --externals
Arguments.Description: Every matched dependency becomes external. An exact matched dependency becomes external. The same string is used as external dependency

Arguments.Name: --externals-reset
Arguments.Description: Clear all items provided in 'externals' configuration. Specify dependencies that shouldn't be resolved by webpack, but should become dependencies of the resulting bundle. The kind of the dependency depends on `output.libraryTarget`

Arguments.Name: --externals-presets-electron
Arguments.Description: Treat common electron built-in modules in main and preload context like 'electron', 'ipc' or 'shell' as external and load them via require() when used

Arguments.Name: --externals-presets-electron-main
Arguments.Description: Treat electron built-in modules in the main context like 'app', 'ipc-main' or 'shell' as external and load them via require() when used

Arguments.Name: --externals-presets-electron-preload
Arguments.Description: Treat electron built-in modules in the preload context like 'web-frame', 'ipc-renderer' or 'shell' as external and load them via require() when used

Arguments.Name: --externals-presets-electron-renderer
Arguments.Description: Treat electron built-in modules in the renderer context like 'web-frame', 'ipc-renderer' or 'shell' as external and load them via require() when used

Arguments.Name: --externals-presets-node
Arguments.Description: Treat node.js built-in modules like fs, path or vm as external and load them via require() when used

Arguments.Name: --externals-presets-nwjs
Arguments.Description: Treat NW.js legacy nw.gui module as external and load it via require() when used

Arguments.Name: --externals-presets-web
Arguments.Description: Treat references to 'http(s)://...' and 'std:...' as external and load them via import when used (Note that this changes execution order as externals are executed before any other code in the chunk)

Arguments.Name: --externals-presets-web-async
Arguments.Description: Treat references to 'http(s)://...' and 'std:...' as external and load them via async import() when used (Note that this external type is an async module, which has various effects on the execution)

Arguments.Name: --externals-type
Arguments.Description: Specifies the default type of externals ('amd*', 'umd*', 'system' and 'jsonp' depend on output.libraryTarget set to the same value)

Arguments.Name: --ignore-warnings
Arguments.Description: A RegExp to select the warning message

Arguments.Name: --ignore-warnings-file
Arguments.Description: A RegExp to select the origin file for the warning

Arguments.Name: --ignore-warnings-message
Arguments.Description: A RegExp to select the warning message

Arguments.Name: --ignore-warnings-module
Arguments.Description: A RegExp to select the origin module for the warning

Arguments.Name: --ignore-warnings-reset
Arguments.Description: Clear all items provided in 'ignoreWarnings' configuration. Ignore specific warnings

Arguments.Name: --infrastructure-logging-append-only
Arguments.Description: Only appends lines to the output. Avoids updating existing output e. g. for status messages. This option is only used when no custom console is provided

Arguments.Name: --infrastructure-logging-colors
Arguments.Description: Enables/Disables colorful output. This option is only used when no custom console is provided

Arguments.Name: --infrastructure-logging-debug
Arguments.Description: Enable/Disable debug logging for all loggers. Enable debug logging for specific loggers

Arguments.Name: --infrastructure-logging-debug-reset
Arguments.Description: Clear all items provided in 'infrastructureLogging.debug' configuration. Enable debug logging for specific loggers

Arguments.Name: --mode
Arguments.Description: Defines the mode to pass to webpack

Arguments.Name: --module-expr-context-critical
Arguments.Description: Enable warnings for full dynamic dependencies

Arguments.Name: --module-expr-context-recursive
Arguments.Description: Enable recursive directory lookup for full dynamic dependencies. Deprecated: This option has moved to 'module.parser.javascript.exprContextRecursive'

Arguments.Name: --module-expr-context-reg-exp
Arguments.Description: Sets the default regular expression for full dynamic dependencies. Deprecated: This option has moved to 'module.parser.javascript.exprContextRegExp'

Arguments.Name: --module-expr-context-request
Arguments.Description: Set the default request for full dynamic dependencies. Deprecated: This option has moved to 'module.parser.javascript.exprContextRequest'

Arguments.Name: --module-generator-asset-data-url-mimetype
Arguments.Description: Asset mimetype (getting from file extension by default)

Arguments.Name: --module-generator-asset-emit
Arguments.Description: Emit an output asset from this asset module. This can be set to 'false' to omit emitting e. g. for SSR

Arguments.Name: --module-generator-asset-filename
Arguments.Description: Specifies the filename template of output files on disk. You must **not** specify an absolute path here, but the path may contain folders separated by '/'! The specified path is joined with the value of the 'output.path' option to determine the location on disk

Arguments.Name: --module-generator-asset-output-path
Arguments.Description: Emit the asset in the specified folder relative to 'output.path'. This should only be needed when custom 'publicPath' is specified to match the folder structure there

Arguments.Name: --module-generator-asset-public-path
Arguments.Description: The 'publicPath' specifies the public URL address of the output files when referenced in a browser

Arguments.Name: --module-generator-asset-inline-data-url-mimetype
Arguments.Description: Asset mimetype (getting from file extension by default)

Arguments.Name: --module-generator-asset-resource-emit
Arguments.Description: Emit an output asset from this asset module. This can be set to 'false' to omit emitting e. g. for SSR

Arguments.Name: --module-generator-asset-resource-filename
Arguments.Description: Specifies the filename template of output files on disk. You must **not** specify an absolute path here, but the path may contain folders separated by '/'! The specified path is joined with the value of the 'output.path' option to determine the location on disk

Arguments.Name: --module-generator-asset-resource-output-path
Arguments.Description: Emit the asset in the specified folder relative to 'output.path'. This should only be needed when custom 'publicPath' is specified to match the folder structure there

Arguments.Name: --module-generator-asset-resource-public-path
Arguments.Description: The 'publicPath' specifies the public URL address of the output files when referenced in a browser

Arguments.Name: --module-no-parse
Arguments.Description: A regular expression, when matched the module is not parsed. An absolute path, when the module starts with this path it is not parsed

Arguments.Name: --module-no-parse-reset
Arguments.Description: Clear all items provided in 'module.noParse' configuration. Don't parse files matching. It's matched against the full resolved request

Arguments.Name: --module-parser-asset-data-url-condition-max-size
Arguments.Description: Maximum size of asset that should be inline as modules. Default: 8kb

Arguments.Name: --module-parser-javascript-browserify
Arguments.Description: Enable/disable special handling for browserify bundles

Arguments.Name: --module-parser-javascript-commonjs-magic-comments
Arguments.Description: Enable/disable parsing of magic comments in CommonJs syntax

Arguments.Name: --module-parser-javascript-exports-presence
Arguments.Description: Specifies the behavior of invalid export names in "import ... from ..." and "export ... from ..."

Arguments.Name: --module-parser-javascript-expr-context-critical
Arguments.Description: Enable warnings for full dynamic dependencies

Arguments.Name: --module-parser-javascript-expr-context-recursive
Arguments.Description: Enable recursive directory lookup for full dynamic dependencies

Arguments.Name: --module-parser-javascript-expr-context-reg-exp
Arguments.Description: Sets the default regular expression for full dynamic dependencies

Arguments.Name: --module-parser-javascript-expr-context-request
Arguments.Description: Set the default request for full dynamic dependencies

Arguments.Name: --module-parser-javascript-harmony
Arguments.Description: Enable/disable parsing of EcmaScript Modules syntax

Arguments.Name: --module-parser-javascript-import-exports-presence
Arguments.Description: Specifies the behavior of invalid export names in "import ... from ..."

Arguments.Name: --module-parser-javascript-node-dirname
Arguments.Description: Include a polyfill for the '__dirname' variable

Arguments.Name: --module-parser-javascript-node-filename
Arguments.Description: Include a polyfill for the '__filename' variable

Arguments.Name: --module-parser-javascript-node-global
Arguments.Description: Include a polyfill for the 'global' variable

Arguments.Name: --module-parser-javascript-reexport-exports-presence
Arguments.Description: Specifies the behavior of invalid export names in "export ... from ...". This might be useful to disable during the migration from "export ... from ..." to "export type ... from ..." when reexporting types in TypeScript

Arguments.Name: --module-parser-javascript-require-js
Arguments.Description: Enable/disable parsing of require.js special syntax like require.config, requirejs.config, require.version and requirejs.onError

Arguments.Name: --module-parser-javascript-strict-export-presence
Arguments.Description: Deprecated in favor of "exportsPresence". Emit errors instead of warnings when imported names don't exist in imported module

Arguments.Name: --module-parser-javascript-strict-this-context-on-imports
Arguments.Description: Handle the this context correctly according to the spec for namespace objects

Arguments.Name: --module-parser-javascript-system
Arguments.Description: Enable/disable parsing of System.js special syntax like System.import, System.get, System.set and System.register

Arguments.Name: --module-parser-javascript-unknown-context-critical
Arguments.Description: Enable warnings when using the require function in a not statically analyse-able way

Arguments.Name: --module-parser-javascript-unknown-context-recursive
Arguments.Description: Enable recursive directory lookup when using the require function in a not statically analyse-able way

Arguments.Name: --module-parser-javascript-unknown-context-reg-exp
Arguments.Description: Sets the regular expression when using the require function in a not statically analyse-able way

Arguments.Name: --module-parser-javascript-unknown-context-request
Arguments.Description: Sets the request when using the require function in a not statically analyse-able way

Arguments.Name: --module-parser-javascript-url
Arguments.Description: Enable/disable parsing of new URL() syntax

Arguments.Name: --module-parser-javascript-worker
Arguments.Description: Specify a syntax that should be parsed as WebWorker reference. 'Abc' handles 'new Abc()', 'Abc from xyz' handles 'import { Abc } from "xyz"; new Abc()', 'abc()' handles 'abc()', and combinations are also possible. Disable or configure parsing of WebWorker syntax like new Worker() or navigator.serviceWorker.register()

Arguments.Name: --module-parser-javascript-worker-reset
Arguments.Description: Clear all items provided in 'module.parser.javascript.worker' configuration. Disable or configure parsing of WebWorker syntax like new Worker() or navigator.serviceWorker.register()

Arguments.Name: --module-parser-javascript-wrapped-context-critical
Arguments.Description: Enable warnings for partial dynamic dependencies

Arguments.Name: --module-parser-javascript-wrapped-context-recursive
Arguments.Description: Enable recursive directory lookup for partial dynamic dependencies

Arguments.Name: --module-parser-javascript-wrapped-context-reg-exp
Arguments.Description: Set the inner regular expression for partial dynamic dependencies

Arguments.Name: --module-parser-javascript-auto-browserify
Arguments.Description: Enable/disable special handling for browserify bundles

Arguments.Name: --module-parser-javascript-auto-commonjs-magic-comments
Arguments.Description: Enable/disable parsing of magic comments in CommonJs syntax

Arguments.Name: --module-parser-javascript-auto-exports-presence
Arguments.Description: Specifies the behavior of invalid export names in "import ... from ..." and "export ... from ..."

Arguments.Name: --module-parser-javascript-auto-expr-context-critical
Arguments.Description: Enable warnings for full dynamic dependencies

Arguments.Name: --module-parser-javascript-auto-expr-context-recursive
Arguments.Description: Enable recursive directory lookup for full dynamic dependencies

Arguments.Name: --module-parser-javascript-auto-expr-context-reg-exp
Arguments.Description: Sets the default regular expression for full dynamic dependencies

Arguments.Name: --module-parser-javascript-auto-expr-context-request
Arguments.Description: Set the default request for full dynamic dependencies

Arguments.Description: Sets the regular expression when using the require function in a not statically analyse-able way

Arguments.Name: --module-parser-javascript-esm-unknown-context-request
Arguments.Description: Sets the request when using the require function in a not statically analyse-able way

Arguments.Name: --module-parser-javascript-esm-url
Arguments.Description: Enable/disable parsing of new URL() syntax

Arguments.Name: --module-parser-javascript-esm-worker
Arguments.Description: Specify a syntax that should be parsed as WebWorker reference. 'Abc' handles 'new Abc()', 'Abc from xyz' handles 'import { Abc } from "xyz"; new Abc()', 'abc()' handles 'abc()', and combinations are also possible. Disable or configure parsing of WebWorker syntax like new Worker() or navigator.serviceWorker.register()

Arguments.Name: --module-parser-javascript-esm-worker-reset
Arguments.Description: Clear all items provided in 'module.parser.javascript/esm.worker' configuration. Disable or configure parsing of WebWorker syntax like new Worker() or navigator.serviceWorker.register()

Arguments.Name: --module-parser-javascript-esm-wrapped-context-critical
Arguments.Description: Enable warnings for partial dynamic dependencies

Arguments.Name: --module-parser-javascript-esm-wrapped-context-recursive
Arguments.Description: Enable recursive directory lookup for partial dynamic dependencies

Arguments.Name: --module-parser-javascript-esm-wrapped-context-reg-exp
Arguments.Description: Set the inner regular expression for partial dynamic dependencies

Arguments.Name: --module-rules-enforce
Arguments.Description: Enforce this rule as pre or post step

Arguments.Name: --module-rules-issuer
Arguments.Description: Match the issuer of the module (The module pointing to this module)

Arguments.Name: --module-rules-issuer-layer
Arguments.Description: Match layer of the issuer of this module (The module pointing to this module)

Arguments.Name: --module-rules-layer
Arguments.Description: Specifies the layer in which the module should be placed in

Arguments.Name: --module-rules-mimetype
Arguments.Description: Match module mimetype when load from Data URI

Arguments.Name: --module-rules-real-resource
Arguments.Description: Match the real resource path of the module

Arguments.Name: --module-rules-resource
Arguments.Description: Match the resource path of the module

Arguments.Name: --module-rules-resource-fragment
Arguments.Description: Match the resource fragment of the module

Arguments.Name: --module-rules-resource-query
Arguments.Description: Match the resource query of the module

Arguments.Name: --module-rules-side-effects
Arguments.Description: Flags a module as with or without side effects

Arguments.Name: --module-rules-type
Arguments.Description: Module type to use for the module

Arguments.Name: --module-rules-reset
Arguments.Description: Clear all items provided in 'module.rules' configuration. A list of rules

Arguments.Name: --module-strict-export-presence
Arguments.Description: Emit errors instead of warnings when imported names don't exist in imported module. Deprecated: This option has moved to 'module.parser.javascript.strictExportPresence'

Arguments.Name: --module-strict-this-context-on-imports
Arguments.Description: Handle the this context correctly according to the spec for namespace objects. Deprecated: This option has moved to 'module.parser.javascript.strictThisContextOnImports'

Arguments.Name: --module-unknown-context-critical
Arguments.Description: Enable warnings when using the require function in a not statically analyse-able way. Deprecated: This option has moved to 'module.parser.javascript.unknownContextCritical'

Arguments.Name: --module-unknown-context-recursive
Arguments.Description: Enable recursive directory lookup when using the require function in a not statically analyse-able way. Deprecated: This option has moved to 'module.parser.javascript.unknownContextRecursive'

Arguments.Name: --module-unknown-context-reg-exp
Arguments.Description: Sets the regular expression when using the require function in a not statically analyse-able way. Deprecated: This option has moved to 'module.parser.javascript.unknownContextRegExp'

Arguments.Name: --module-unknown-context-request
Arguments.Description: Sets the request when using the require function in a not statically analyse-able way. Deprecated: This option has moved to 'module.parser.javascript.unknownContextRequest'

Arguments.Name: --module-unsafe-cache
Arguments.Description: Cache the resolving of module requests

Arguments.Name: --module-wrapped-context-critical
Arguments.Description: Enable warnings for partial dynamic dependencies. Deprecated: This option has moved to 'module.parser.javascript.wrappedContextCritical'

Arguments.Name: --module-wrapped-context-recursive
Arguments.Description: Enable recursive directory lookup for partial dynamic dependencies. Deprecated: This option has moved to 'module.parser.javascript.wrappedContextRecursive'

Arguments.Name: --module-wrapped-context-reg-exp
Arguments.Description: Set the inner regular expression for partial dynamic dependencies. Deprecated: This option has moved to 'module.parser.javascript.wrappedContextRegExp'

Arguments.Name: --name
Arguments.Description: Name of the configuration. Used when loading multiple configurations

Arguments.Name: --node-dirname
Arguments.Description: Include a polyfill for the '__dirname' variable

Arguments.Name: --node-filename
Arguments.Description: Include a polyfill for the '__filename' variable

Arguments.Name: --node-global
Arguments.Description: Include a polyfill for the 'global' variable

Arguments.Name: --optimization-check-wasm-types
Arguments.Description: Check for incompatible wasm types when importing/exporting from/to ESM

Arguments.Name: --optimization-chunk-ids
Arguments.Description: Define the algorithm to choose chunk ids (named: readable ids for better debugging, deterministic: numeric hash ids for better long term caching, size: numeric ids focused on minimal initial download size, total-size: numeric ids focused on minimal total download size, false: no algorithm used, as custom one can be provided via plugin)

Arguments.Name: --optimization-concatenate-modules
Arguments.Description: Concatenate modules when possible to generate less modules, more efficient code and enable more optimizations by the minimizer

Arguments.Name: --optimization-emit-on-errors
Arguments.Description: Emit assets even when errors occur. Critical errors are emitted into the generated code and will cause errors at runtime

Arguments.Name: --optimization-flag-included-chunks
Arguments.Description: Also flag chunks as loaded which contain a subset of the modules

Arguments.Name: --optimization-inner-graph
Arguments.Description: Creates a module-internal dependency graph for top level symbols, exports and imports, to improve unused exports detection

Arguments.Name: --optimization-mangle-exports
Arguments.Description: Rename exports when possible to generate shorter code (depends on optimization.usedExports and optimization.providedExports, true/"deterministic": generate short deterministic names optimized for caching, "size": generate the shortest possible names)

Arguments.Name: --optimization-mangle-wasm-imports
Arguments.Description: Reduce size of WASM by changing imports to shorter strings

Arguments.Name: --optimization-merge-duplicate-chunks
Arguments.Description: Merge chunks which contain the same modules

Arguments.Name: --optimization-minimize
Arguments.Description: Enable minimizing the output. Uses optimization.minimizer

Arguments.Name: --optimization-module-ids
Arguments.Description: Define the algorithm to choose module ids (natural: numeric ids in order of usage, named: readable ids for better debugging, hashed: (deprecated) short hashes as ids for better long term caching, deterministic: numeric hash ids for better long term caching, size: numeric ids focused on minimal initial download size, false: no algorithm used, as custom one can be provided via plugin)

Arguments.Name: --optimization-node-env
Arguments.Description: Set process.env.NODE_ENV to a specific value

Arguments.Name: --optimization-portable-records
Arguments.Description: Generate records with relative paths to be able to move the context folder

Arguments.Name: --optimization-provided-exports
Arguments.Description: Figure out which exports are provided by modules to generate more efficient code

Arguments.Name: --optimization-real-content-hash
Arguments.Description: Use real [contenthash] based on final content of the assets

Arguments.Name: --optimization-remove-available-modules
Arguments.Description: Removes modules from chunks when these modules are already included in all parents

Arguments.Name: --optimization-runtime-chunk
Arguments.Description: Create an additional chunk which contains only the webpack runtime and chunk hash maps

Arguments.Name: --optimization-runtime-chunk-name
Arguments.Description: The name or name factory for the runtime chunks

Arguments.Name: --optimization-side-effects
Arguments.Description: Skip over modules which contain no side effects when exports are not used (false: disabled, 'flag': only use manually placed side effects flag, true: also analyse source code for side effects)

Arguments.Name: --optimization-split-chunks-automatic-name-delimiter
Arguments.Description: Sets the name delimiter for created chunks

Arguments.Name: --optimization-split-chunks-chunks
Arguments.Description: Select chunks for determining shared modules (defaults to "async", "initial" and "all" requires adding these chunks to the HTML)

Arguments.Name: --optimization-split-chunks-default-size-types-reset
Arguments.Description: Clear all items provided in 'optimization.splitChunks.defaultSizeTypes' configuration. Sets the size types which are used when a number is used for sizes

Arguments.Name: --optimization-split-chunks-enforce-size-threshold
Arguments.Description: Size of the javascript part of the chunk
Sets the name delimiter for created chunks

Arguments.Name: --optimization-split-chunks-fallback-cache-group-chunks
Arguments.Description: Select chunks for determining shared modules (defaults to "async", "initial" and "all" requires adding these chunks to the HTML)

Arguments.Name: --optimization-split-chunks-fallback-cache-group-max-async-size
Arguments.Description: Size of the javascript part of the chunk

Arguments.Name: --optimization-split-chunks-fallback-cache-group-max-initial-size
Arguments.Description: Size of the javascript part of the chunk

Arguments.Name: --optimization-split-chunks-fallback-cache-group-max-size
Arguments.Description: Size of the javascript part of the chunk

Arguments.Name: --optimization-split-chunks-fallback-cache-group-min-size
Arguments.Description: Size of the javascript part of the chunk

Arguments.Name: --optimization-split-chunks-fallback-cache-group-min-size-reduction
Arguments.Description: Size of the javascript part of the chunk

Arguments.Name: --optimization-split-chunks-filename
Arguments.Description: Sets the template for the filename for created chunks

Arguments.Name: --optimization-split-chunks-hide-path-info
Arguments.Description: Prevents exposing path info when creating names for parts splitted by maxSize

Arguments.Name: --optimization-split-chunks-max-async-requests
Arguments.Description: Maximum number of requests which are accepted for on-demand loading

Arguments.Name: --optimization-split-chunks-max-async-size
Arguments.Description: Size of the javascript part of the chunk

Arguments.Name: --optimization-split-chunks-max-initial-requests
Arguments.Description: Maximum number of initial chunks which are accepted for an entry point

Arguments.Name: --optimization-split-chunks-max-initial-size
Arguments.Description: Size of the javascript part of the chunk

Arguments.Name: --optimization-split-chunks-max-size
Arguments.Description: Size of the javascript part of the chunk

Arguments.Name: --optimization-split-chunks-min-chunks
Arguments.Description: Minimum number of times a module has to be duplicated until it's considered for splitting

Arguments.Name: --optimization-split-chunks-min-remaining-size
Arguments.Description: Size of the javascript part of the chunk

Arguments.Name: --optimization-split-chunks-min-size
Arguments.Description: Size of the javascript part of the chunk

Arguments.Name: --optimization-split-chunks-min-size-reduction
Arguments.Description: Size of the javascript part of the chunk

Arguments.Name: --optimization-split-chunks-name
Arguments.Description: Give chunks created a name (chunks with equal name are merged)

Arguments.Name: --optimization-split-chunks-used-exports
Arguments.Description: Compare used exports when checking common modules. Modules will only be put in the same chunk when exports are equal

Arguments.Name: --optimization-used-exports
Arguments.Description: Figure out which exports are used by modules to mangle export names, omit unused exports and generate more efficient code (true: analyse used exports for each runtime, "global": analyse exports globally for all runtimes combined)

Arguments.Name: --output-asset-module-filename
Arguments.Description: The filename of asset modules as relative path inside the 'output.path' directory

Arguments.Name: --output-async-chunks
Arguments.Description: Enable/disable creating async chunks that are loaded on demand

Arguments.Name: --output-charset
Arguments.Description: Add charset attribute for script tag

Arguments.Name: --output-chunk-filename
Arguments.Description: Specifies the filename template of output files on disk. You must **not** specify an absolute path here, but the path may contain folders separated by '/'! The specified path is joined with the value of the 'output.path' option to determine the location on disk

Arguments.Name: --output-chunk-format
Arguments.Description: The format of chunks (formats included by default are 'array-push' (web/WebWorker), 'commonjs' (node.js), 'module' (ESM), but others might be added by plugins)

Arguments.Name: --output-chunk-load-timeout
Arguments.Description: Number of milliseconds before chunk request expires

Arguments.Name: --output-chunk-loading
Arguments.Description: The method of loading chunks (methods included by default are 'jsonp' (web), 'import' (ESM), 'importScripts' (WebWorker), 'require' (sync node.js), 'async-node' (async node.js), but others might be added by plugins)

Arguments.Name: --output-chunk-loading-global
Arguments.Description: The global variable used by webpack for loading of chunks

Arguments.Name: --output-clean
Arguments.Description: Clean the output directory before emit

Arguments.Name: --output-clean-dry
Arguments.Description: Log the assets that should be removed instead of deleting them

Arguments.Name: --output-compare-before-emit
Arguments.Description: Check if to be emitted file already exists and have the same content before writing to output filesystem

Arguments.Name: --output-cross-origin-loading
Arguments.Description: This option enables cross-origin loading of chunks

Arguments.Name: --output-css-chunk-filename
Arguments.Description: Specifies the filename template of output files on disk. You must **not** specify an absolute path here, but the path may contain folders separated by '/'! The specified path is joined with the value of the 'output.path' option to determine the location on disk

Arguments.Name: --output-css-filename
Arguments.Description: Specifies the filename template of output files on disk. You must **not** specify an absolute path here, but the path may contain folders separated by '/'! The specified path is joined with the value of the 'output.path' option to determine the location on disk

Arguments.Name: --output-devtool-fallback-module-filename-template
Arguments.Description: Similar to `output.devtoolModuleFilenameTemplate`, but used in the case of duplicate module identifiers

Arguments.Name: --output-devtool-module-filename-template
Arguments.Description: Filename template string of function for the sources array in a generated SourceMap

Arguments.Name: --output-devtool-namespace
Arguments.Description: Module namespace to use when interpolating filename template string for the sources array in a generated SourceMap. Defaults to `output.library` if not set. It's useful for avoiding runtime collisions in sourcemaps from multiple webpack projects built as libraries

Arguments.Name: --output-enabled-chunk-loading-types
Arguments.Description: The method of loading chunks (methods included by default are 'jsonp' (web), 'import' (ESM), 'importScripts' (WebWorker), 'require' (sync node.js), 'async-node' (async node.js), but others might be added by plugins)

Arguments.Name: --output-enabled-chunk-loading-types-reset
Arguments.Description: Clear all items provided in 'output.enabledChunkLoadingTypes' configuration. List of chunk loading types enabled for use by entry points

Arguments.Name: --output-enabled-library-types
Arguments.Description: Type of library (types included by default are 'var', 'module', 'assign', 'assign-properties', 'this', 'window', 'self', 'global', 'commonjs', 'commonjs2', 'commonjs-module', 'commonjs-static', 'amd', 'amd-require', 'umd', 'umd2', 'jsonp', 'system', but others might be added by plugins)

Arguments.Name: --output-enabled-library-types-reset
Arguments.Description: Clear all items provided in 'output.enabledLibraryTypes' configuration. List of library types enabled for use by entry points

Arguments.Name: --output-enabled-wasm-loading-types
Arguments.Description: The method of loading WebAssembly Modules (methods included by default are 'fetch' (web/WebWorker), 'async-node' (node.js), but others might be added by plugins)

Arguments.Name: --output-enabled-wasm-loading-types-reset
Arguments.Description: Clear all items provided in 'output.enabledWasmLoadingTypes' configuration. List of wasm loading types enabled for use by entry points

Arguments.Name: --output-environment-big-int-literal
Arguments.Description: The environment supports BigInt as literal (123n)

Arguments.Name: --output-environment-const
Arguments.Description: The environment supports const and let for variable declarations

Arguments.Name: --output-environment-destructuring
Arguments.Description: The environment supports destructuring ('{ a, b } = obj')

Arguments.Name: --output-environment-dynamic-import
Arguments.Description: The environment supports an async import() function to import EcmaScript modules

Arguments.Name: --output-environment-for-of
Arguments.Description: The environment supports 'for of' iteration ('for (const x of array) { ... }')

Arguments.Name: --output-environment-module
Arguments.Description: The environment supports EcmaScript Module syntax to import EcmaScript modules (import ... from '...')

Arguments.Name: --output-environment-optional-chaining
Arguments.Description: The environment supports optional chaining ('obj?.a' or 'obj?.()')

Arguments.Name: --output-filename
Arguments.Description: Specifies the filename template of output files on disk. You must **not** specify an absolute path here, but the path may contain folders separated by '/'! The specified path is joined with the value of the 'output.path' option to determine the location on disk

Arguments.Name: --output-global-object
Arguments.Description: An expression which is used to address the global object/scope in runtime code

Arguments.Name: --output-hash-digest
Arguments.Description: Digest type used for the hash

Arguments.Name: --output-hash-digest-length
Arguments.Description: Number of chars which are used for the hash

Arguments.Name: --output-hash-function
Arguments.Description: Algorithm used for generation the hash (see node.js crypto package)

Arguments.Name: --output-hash-salt
Arguments.Description: Any string which is added to the hash to salt it

Arguments.Name: --output-hot-update-chunk-filename
Arguments.Description: The filename of the Hot Update Chunks. They are inside the output.path directory

Arguments.Name: --output-hot-update-global
Arguments.Description: The global variable used by webpack for loading of hot update chunks

Arguments.Name: --output-hot-update-main-filename
Arguments.Description: The filename of the Hot Update Main File. It is inside the 'output.path' directory

Arguments.Name: --output-iife
Arguments.Description: Wrap javascript code into IIFE's to avoid leaking into global scope

Arguments.Name: --output-import-function-name
Arguments.Description: The name of the native import() function (can be exchanged for a polyfill)

Arguments.Name: --output-import-meta-name
Arguments.Description: The name of the native import.meta object (can be exchanged for a polyfill)

Arguments.Name: --output-library
Arguments.Description: A part of the library name

Arguments.Name: --output-library-reset
Arguments.Description: Clear all items provided in 'output.library' configuration. The name of the library (some types allow unnamed libraries too)

Arguments.Name: --output-library-amd
Arguments.Description: Name of the exposed AMD library in the UMD

Arguments.Name: --output-library-commonjs
Arguments.Description: Name of the exposed commonjs export in the UMD

Arguments.Name: --output-library-root
Arguments.Description: Part of the name of the property exposed globally by a UMD library

Arguments.Name: --output-library-root-reset
Arguments.Description: Clear all items provided in 'output.library.root' configuration. Name of the property exposed globally by a UMD library

Arguments.Name: --output-library-auxiliary-comment
Arguments.Description: Append the same comment above each import style

Arguments.Name: --output-library-auxiliary-comment-amd
Arguments.Description: Set comment for `amd` section in UMD

Arguments.Name: --output-library-auxiliary-comment-commonjs
Arguments.Description: Set comment for `commonjs` (exports) section in UMD

Arguments.Name: --output-library-auxiliary-comment-commonjs2
Arguments.Description: Set comment for `commonjs2` (module.exports) section in UMD

Arguments.Name: --output-library-auxiliary-comment-root
Arguments.Description: Set comment for `root` (global variable) section in UMD

Arguments.Name: --output-library-export
Arguments.Description: Part of the export that should be exposed as library

Arguments.Name: --output-library-export-reset
Arguments.Description: Clear all items provided in 'output.library.export' configuration. Specify which export should be exposed as library

Arguments.Name: --output-library-name
Arguments.Description: A part of the library name

Arguments.Name: --output-library-name-reset
Arguments.Description: Clear all items provided in 'output.library.name' configuration. The name of the library (some types allow unnamed libraries too)

Arguments.Name: --output-library-name-amd
Arguments.Description: Name of the exposed AMD library in the UMD

Arguments.Name: --output-library-name-commonjs
Arguments.Description: Name of the exposed commonjs export in the UMD

Arguments.Name: --output-library-name-root
Arguments.Description: Part of the name of the property exposed globally by a UMD library

Arguments.Name: --output-library-name-root-reset
Arguments.Description: Clear all items provided in 'output.library.name.root' configuration. Name of the property exposed globally by a UMD library

Arguments.Name: --output-library-type
Arguments.Description: Type of library (types included by default are 'var', 'module', 'assign', 'assign-properties', 'this', 'window', 'self', 'global', 'commonjs', 'commonjs2', 'commonjs-module', 'commonjs-static', 'amd', 'amd-require', 'umd', 'umd2', 'jsonp', 'system', but others might be added by plugins)

Arguments.Name: --output-library-umd-named-define
Arguments.Description: If `output.libraryTarget` is set to umd and `output.library` is set, setting this to true will name the AMD module

Arguments.Name: --output-module
Arguments.Description: Output javascript files as module source type

Arguments.Name: --output-path
Arguments.Description: Output location of the file generated by webpack e.g. ./dist/

Arguments.Name: --output-pathinfo
Arguments.Description: Include comments with information about the modules

Arguments.Name: --output-public-path
Arguments.Description: The 'publicPath' specifies the public URL address of the output files when referenced in a browser

Arguments.Name: --output-script-type
Arguments.Description: This option enables loading async chunks via a custom script type, such as script type="module"

Arguments.Name: --output-source-map-filename
Arguments.Description: The filename of the SourceMaps for the JavaScript files. They are inside the 'output.path' directory

Arguments.Name: --output-source-prefix
Arguments.Description: Prefixes every line of the source in the bundle with this string

Arguments.Name: --output-strict-module-error-handling
Arguments.Description: Handles error in module loading correctly at a performance cost. This will handle module error compatible with the EcmaScript Modules spec

Arguments.Name: --output-strict-module-exception-handling
Arguments.Description: Handles exceptions in module loading correctly at a performance cost (Deprecated). This will handle module error compatible with the Node.js CommonJS way

Arguments.Name: --output-trusted-types
Arguments.Description: Use a Trusted Types policy to create urls for chunks. 'output.uniqueName' is used a default policy name. Passing a string sets a custom policy name. The name of the Trusted Types policy created by webpack to serve bundle chunks

Arguments.Name: --output-trusted-types-policy-name
Arguments.Description: The name of the Trusted Types policy created by webpack to serve bundle chunks

Arguments.Name: --output-unique-name
Arguments.Description: A unique name of the webpack build to avoid multiple webpack runtimes to conflict when using globals

Arguments.Name: --output-wasm-loading
Arguments.Description: The method of loading WebAssembly Modules (methods included by default are 'fetch' (web/WebWorker), 'async-node' (node.js), but others might be added by plugins)

Arguments.Name: --output-webassembly-module-filename
Arguments.Description: The filename of WebAssembly modules as relative path inside the 'output.path' directory

Arguments.Name: --output-worker-chunk-loading
Arguments.Description: The method of loading chunks (methods included by default are 'jsonp' (web), 'import' (ESM), 'importScripts' (WebWorker), 'require' (sync node.js), 'async-node' (async node.js), but others might be added by plugins)

Arguments.Name: --output-worker-wasm-loading
Arguments.Description: The method of loading WebAssembly Modules (methods included by default are 'fetch' (web/WebWorker), 'async-node' (node.js), but others might be added by plugins)

Arguments.Name: --parallelism
Arguments.Description: The number of parallel processed modules in the compilation

Arguments.Name: --performance-hints
Arguments.Description: Sets the format of the hints: warnings, errors or nothing at all

Arguments.Name: --performance-max-asset-size
Arguments.Description: File size limit (in bytes) when exceeded, that webpack will provide performance hints

Arguments.Name: --performance-max-entrypoint-size
Arguments.Description: Total size of an entry point (in bytes)

Arguments.Name: --profile
Arguments.Description: Capture timing information for each module

Arguments.Name: --records-input-path
Arguments.Description: Store compiler state to a json file

Arguments.Name: --records-output-path
Arguments.Description: Load compiler state from a json file

Arguments.Name: --records-path
Arguments.Description: Store/Load compiler state from/to a json file. This will result in persistent ids of modules and chunks. An absolute path is expected. `recordsPath` is used for `recordsInputPath` and `recordsOutputPath` if they left undefined

Arguments.Name: --resolve-alias-alias
Arguments.Description: Ignore request (replace with empty module). New request

Arguments.Name: --resolve-alias-reset
Arguments.Description: Clear all items provided in 'resolve.alias' configuration. Redirect module requests

Arguments.Name: --resolve-alias-fields
Arguments.Description: Field in the description file (usually package.json) which are used to redirect requests inside the module

Arguments.Name: --resolve-alias-fields-reset
Arguments.Description: Clear all items provided in 'resolve.aliasFields' configuration. Fields in the description file (usually package.json) which are used to redirect requests inside the module

Arguments.Name: --resolve-cache
Arguments.Description: Enable caching of successfully resolved requests (cache entries are revalidated)

Arguments.Name: --resolve-cache-with-context
Arguments.Description: Include the context information in the cache identifier when caching

Arguments.Name: --resolve-condition-names
Arguments.Description: Condition names for exports field entry point

Arguments.Name: --resolve-condition-names-reset
Arguments.Description: Clear all items provided in 'resolve.conditionNames' configuration. Condition names for exports field entry point

Arguments.Name: --resolve-description-files
Arguments.Description: Filename used to find a description file (like a package.json)

Arguments.Name: --resolve-description-files-reset
Arguments.Description: Clear all items provided in 'resolve.descriptionFiles' configuration. Filenames used to find a description file (like a package.json)

Arguments.Name: --resolve-enforce-extension
Arguments.Description: Enforce the resolver to use one of the extensions from the extensions option (User must specify requests without extension)

Arguments.Name: --resolve-exports-fields
Arguments.Description: Field name from the description file (usually package.json) which is used to provide entry points of a package

Arguments.Name: --resolve-exports-fields-reset
Arguments.Description: Clear all items provided in 'resolve.exportsFields' configuration. Field names from the description file (usually package.json) which are used to provide entry points of a package

Arguments.Name: --resolve-extensions
Arguments.Description: Extension added to the request when trying to find the file

Arguments.Name: --resolve-extensions-reset
Arguments.Description: Clear all items provided in 'resolve.extensions' configuration. Extensions added to the request when trying to find the file

Arguments.Name: --resolve-fallback-alias
Arguments.Description: Ignore request (replace with empty module). New request

Arguments.Name: --resolve-fallback-reset
Arguments.Description: Clear all items provided in 'resolve.fallback' configuration. Redirect module requests

Arguments.Name: --resolve-fully-specified
Arguments.Description: Treats the request specified by the user as fully specified, meaning no extensions are added and the mainFiles in directories are not resolved (This doesn't affect requests from mainFields, aliasFields or aliases)

Arguments.Name: --resolve-imports-fields
Arguments.Description: Field name from the description file (usually package.json) which is used to provide internal request of a package (requests starting with # are considered as internal)

Arguments.Name: --resolve-imports-fields-reset
Arguments.Description: Clear all items provided in 'resolve.importsFields' configuration. Field names from the description file (usually package.json) which are used to provide internal request of a package (requests starting with # are considered as internal)

Arguments.Name: --resolve-main-fields
Arguments.Description: Field name from the description file (package.json) which are used to find the default entry point

Arguments.Name: --resolve-main-fields-reset
Arguments.Description: Clear all items provided in 'resolve.mainFields' configuration. Field names from the description file (package.json) which are used to find the default entry point

Arguments.Name: --resolve-main-files
Arguments.Description: Filename used to find the default entry point if there is no description file or main field

Arguments.Name: --resolve-main-files-reset
Arguments.Description: Clear all items provided in 'resolve.mainFiles' configuration. Filenames used to find the default entry point if there is no description file or main field

Arguments.Name: --resolve-modules
Arguments.Description: Folder name or directory path where to find modules

Arguments.Name: --resolve-modules-reset
Arguments.Description: Clear all items provided in 'resolve.modules' configuration. Folder names or directory paths where to find modules

Arguments.Name: --resolve-prefer-absolute
Arguments.Description: Prefer to resolve server-relative URLs (starting with '/') as absolute paths before falling back to resolve in 'resolve.roots'

Arguments.Name: --resolve-prefer-relative
Arguments.Description: Prefer to resolve module requests as relative request and fallback to resolving as module

Arguments.Name: --resolve-restrictions
Arguments.Description: Resolve restriction. Resolve result must fulfill this restriction

Arguments.Name: --resolve-restrictions-reset
Arguments.Description: Clear all items provided in 'resolve.restrictions' configuration. A list of resolve restrictions. Resolve results must fulfill all of these restrictions to resolve successfully. Other resolve paths are taken when restrictions are not met

Arguments.Name: --resolve-roots
Arguments.Description: Directory in which requests that are server-relative URLs (starting with '/') are resolved

Arguments.Name: --resolve-roots-reset
Arguments.Description: Clear all items provided in 'resolve.roots' configuration. A list of directories in which requests that are server-relative URLs (starting with '/') are resolved

Arguments.Name: --resolve-symlinks
Arguments.Description: Enable resolving symlinks to the original location

Arguments.Name: --resolve-unsafe-cache
Arguments.Description: Enable caching of successfully resolved requests (cache entries are not revalidated)

Arguments.Name: --resolve-use-sync-file-system-calls
Arguments.Description: Use synchronous filesystem calls for the resolver

Arguments.Name: --resolve-loader-alias-alias
Arguments.Description: Ignore request (replace with empty module). New request

Arguments.Name: --resolve-loader-alias-reset
Arguments.Description: Clear all items provided in 'resolveLoader.alias' configuration. Redirect module requests

Arguments.Name: --resolve-loader-alias-fields
Arguments.Description: Field in the description file (usually package.json) which are used to redirect requests inside the module

Arguments.Name: --resolve-loader-alias-fields-reset
Arguments.Description: Clear all items provided in 'resolveLoader.aliasFields' configuration. Fields in the description file (usually package.json) which are used to redirect requests inside the module

Arguments.Name: --resolve-loader-cache
Arguments.Description: Enable caching of successfully resolved requests (cache entries are revalidated)

Arguments.Name: --resolve-loader-cache-with-context
Arguments.Description: Include the context information in the cache identifier when caching

Arguments.Name: --resolve-loader-condition-names
Arguments.Description: Condition names for exports field entry point

Arguments.Name: --resolve-loader-condition-names-reset
Arguments.Description: Clear all items provided in 'resolveLoader.conditionNames' configuration. Condition names for exports field entry point

Arguments.Name: --resolve-loader-description-files
Arguments.Description: Filename used to find a description file (like a package.json)

Arguments.Name: --resolve-loader-description-files-reset
Arguments.Description: Clear all items provided in 'resolveLoader.descriptionFiles' configuration. Filenames used to find a description file (like a package.json)

Arguments.Name: --resolve-loader-enforce-extension
Arguments.Description: Enforce the resolver to use one of the extensions from the extensions option (User must specify requests without extension)

Arguments.Name: --resolve-loader-exports-fields
Arguments.Description: Field name from the description file (usually package.json) which is used to provide entry points of a package

Arguments.Name: --resolve-loader-exports-fields-reset
Arguments.Description: Clear all items provided in 'resolveLoader.exportsFields' configuration. Field names from the description file (usually package.json) which are used to provide entry points of a package

Arguments.Name: --resolve-loader-extensions
Arguments.Description: Extension added to the request when trying to find the file

Arguments.Name: --resolve-loader-extensions-reset
Arguments.Description: Clear all items provided in 'resolveLoader.extensions' configuration. Extensions added to the request when trying to find the file

Arguments.Name: --resolve-loader-fallback-alias
Arguments.Description: Ignore request (replace with empty module). New request

Arguments.Name: --resolve-loader-fallback-reset
Arguments.Description: Clear all items provided in 'resolveLoader.fallback' configuration. Redirect module requests

Arguments.Name: --resolve-loader-fully-specified
Arguments.Description: Treats the request specified by the user as fully specified, meaning no extensions are added and the mainFiles in directories are not resolved (This doesn't affect requests from mainFields, aliasFields or aliases)

Arguments.Name: --resolve-loader-imports-fields
Arguments.Description: Field name from the description file (usually package.json) which is used to provide internal request of a package (requests starting with # are considered as internal)

Arguments.Name: --resolve-loader-imports-fields-reset
Arguments.Description: Clear all items provided in 'resolveLoader.importsFields' configuration. Field names from the description file (usually package.json) which are used to provide internal request of a package (requests starting with # are considered as internal)

Arguments.Name: --resolve-loader-main-fields
Arguments.Description: Field name from the description file (package.json) which are used to find the default entry point

Arguments.Name: --resolve-loader-main-fields-reset
Arguments.Description: Clear all items provided in 'resolveLoader.mainFields' configuration. Field names from the description file (package.json) which are used to find the default entry point

Arguments.Name: --resolve-loader-main-files
Arguments.Description: Filename used to find the default entry point if there is no description file or main field

Arguments.Name: --resolve-loader-main-files-reset
Arguments.Description: Clear all items provided in 'resolveLoader.mainFiles' configuration. Filenames used to find the default entry point if there is no description file or main field

Arguments.Name: --resolve-loader-modules
Arguments.Description: Folder name or directory path where to find modules

Arguments.Name: --resolve-loader-modules-reset
Arguments.Description: Clear all items provided in 'resolveLoader.modules' configuration. Folder names or directory paths where to find modules

Arguments.Name: --resolve-loader-prefer-absolute
Arguments.Description: Prefer to resolve server-relative URLs (starting with '/') as absolute paths before falling back to resolve in 'resolve.roots'

Arguments.Name: --resolve-loader-prefer-relative
Arguments.Description: Prefer to resolve module requests as relative request and fallback to resolving as module

Arguments.Name: --resolve-loader-restrictions
Arguments.Description: Resolve restriction. Resolve result must fulfill this restriction

Arguments.Name: --resolve-loader-restrictions-reset
Arguments.Description: Clear all items provided in 'resolveLoader.restrictions' configuration. A list of resolve restrictions. Resolve results must fulfill all of these restrictions to resolve successfully. Other resolve paths are taken when restrictions are not met

Arguments.Name: --resolve-loader-roots
Arguments.Description: Directory in which requests that are server-relative URLs (starting with '/') are resolved

Arguments.Name: --resolve-loader-roots-reset
Arguments.Description: Clear all items provided in 'resolveLoader.roots' configuration. A list of directories in which requests that are server-relative URLs (starting with '/') are resolved

Arguments.Name: --resolve-loader-symlinks
Arguments.Description: Enable resolving symlinks to the original location

Arguments.Name: --resolve-loader-unsafe-cache
Arguments.Description: Enable caching of successfully resolved requests (cache entries are not revalidated)

Arguments.Name: --resolve-loader-use-sync-file-system-calls
Arguments.Description: Use synchronous filesystem calls for the resolver

Arguments.Name: --snapshot-build-dependencies-hash
Arguments.Description: Use hashes of the content of the files/directories to determine invalidation

Arguments.Name: --snapshot-build-dependencies-timestamp
Arguments.Description: Use timestamps of the files/directories to determine invalidation

Arguments.Name: --snapshot-immutable-paths
Arguments.Description: A RegExp matching an immutable directory (usually a package manager cache directory, including the tailing slash) A path to an immutable directory (usually a package manager cache directory)

Arguments.Name: --snapshot-immutable-paths-reset
Arguments.Description: Clear all items provided in 'snapshot.immutablePaths' configuration. List of paths that are managed by a package manager and contain a version or hash in its path so all files are immutable

Arguments.Name: --snapshot-managed-paths
Arguments.Description: A RegExp matching a managed directory (usually a node_modules directory, including the tailing slash) A path to a managed directory (usually a node_modules directory)

Arguments.Name: --snapshot-managed-paths-reset
Arguments.Description: Clear all items provided in 'snapshot.managedPaths' configuration. List of paths that are managed by a package manager and can be trusted to not be modified otherwise

Arguments.Name: --snapshot-module-hash
Arguments.Description: Use hashes of the content of the files/directories to determine invalidation

Arguments.Name: --snapshot-module-timestamp
Arguments.Description: Use timestamps of the files/directories to determine invalidation

Arguments.Name: --snapshot-resolve-hash
Arguments.Description: Use hashes of the content of the files/directories to determine invalidation

Arguments.Name: --snapshot-resolve-timestamp
Arguments.Description: Use timestamps of the files/directories to determine invalidation

Arguments.Name: --snapshot-resolve-build-dependencies-hash
Arguments.Description: Use hashes of the content of the files/directories to determine invalidation

Arguments.Name: --snapshot-resolve-build-dependencies-timestamp
Arguments.Description: Use timestamps of the files/directories to determine invalidation

Arguments.Name: --stats
Arguments.Description: It instructs webpack on how to treat the stats e.g. verbose

Arguments.Name: --stats-all
Arguments.Description: Fallback value for stats options when an option is not defined (has precedence over local webpack defaults)

Arguments.Name: --stats-assets-sort
Arguments.Description: Sort the assets by that field

Arguments.Name: --stats-assets-space
Arguments.Description: Space to display assets (groups will be collapsed to fit this space)

Arguments.Name: --stats-cached
Arguments.Description: Add information about cached (not built) modules (deprecated: use 'cachedModules' instead)

Arguments.Name: --stats-cached-assets
Arguments.Description: Show cached assets (setting this to `false` only shows emitted files)

Arguments.Name: --stats-cached-modules
Arguments.Description: Add information about cached (not built) modules

Arguments.Name: --stats-chunk-group-auxiliary
Arguments.Description: Display auxiliary assets in chunk groups

Arguments.Name: --stats-chunk-group-max-assets
Arguments.Description: Limit of assets displayed in chunk groups

Arguments.Name: --stats-chunk-groups
Arguments.Description: Display all chunk groups with the corresponding bundles

Arguments.Name: --stats-chunk-modules
Arguments.Description: Add built modules information to chunk information

Arguments.Name: --stats-chunk-modules-space
Arguments.Description: Space to display chunk modules (groups will be collapsed to fit this space, value is in number of modules/group)

Arguments.Name: --stats-chunk-origins
Arguments.Description: Add the origins of chunks and chunk merging info

Arguments.Name: --stats-chunk-relations
Arguments.Description: Add information about parent, children and sibling chunks to chunk information

Arguments.Name: --stats-chunks-sort
Arguments.Description: Sort the chunks by that field

Arguments.Name: --stats-dependent-modules
Arguments.Description: Show chunk modules that are dependencies of other modules of the chunk

Arguments.Name: --stats-depth
Arguments.Description: Add module depth in module graph

Arguments.Name: --stats-entrypoints
Arguments.Description: Display the entry points with the corresponding bundles

Arguments.Name: --stats-error-details
Arguments.Description: Add details to errors (like resolving log)

Arguments.Name: --stats-error-stack
Arguments.Description: Add internal stack trace to errors

Arguments.Name: --stats-exclude-assets
Arguments.Description: Suppress assets that match the specified filters. Filters can be Strings, RegExps or Functions

Arguments.Name: --stats-exclude-assets-reset
Arguments.Description: Clear all items provided in 'stats.excludeAssets' configuration. Suppress assets that match the specified filters. Filters can be Strings, RegExps or Functions

Arguments.Name: --stats-exclude-modules
Arguments.Description: Suppress modules that match the specified filters. Filters can be Strings, RegExps, Booleans or Functions

Arguments.Name: --stats-exclude-modules-reset
Arguments.Description: Clear all items provided in 'stats.excludeModules' configuration. Suppress modules that match the specified filters. Filters can be Strings, RegExps, Booleans or Functions

Arguments.Name: --stats-group-assets-by-chunk
Arguments.Description: Group assets by how their are related to chunks

Arguments.Name: --stats-group-assets-by-emit-status
Arguments.Description: Group assets by their status (emitted, compared for emit or cached)

Arguments.Name: --stats-group-assets-by-info
Arguments.Description: Group assets by their asset info (immutable, development, hotModuleReplacement, etc)

Arguments.Name: --stats-group-modules-by-attributes
Arguments.Description: Group modules by their attributes (errors, warnings, assets, optional, orphan, or dependent)

Arguments.Name: --stats-group-modules-by-cache-status
Arguments.Description: Group modules by their status (cached or built and cacheable)

Arguments.Name: --stats-group-reasons-by-origin
Arguments.Description: Group reasons by their origin module

Arguments.Name: --stats-hash
Arguments.Description: Add the hash of the compilation

Arguments.Name: --stats-logging
Arguments.Description: Specify log level of logging output. Enable/disable logging output (`true`: shows normal logging output, loglevel: log)

Arguments.Name: --stats-logging-debug
Arguments.Description: Enable/Disable debug logging for all loggers. Include debug logging of specified loggers (i. e. for plugins or loaders). Filters can be Strings, RegExps or Functions

Arguments.Name: --stats-logging-debug-reset
Arguments.Description: Clear all items provided in 'stats.loggingDebug' configuration. Include debug logging of specified loggers (i. e. for plugins or loaders). Filters can be Strings, RegExps or Functions

Arguments.Name: --stats-logging-trace
Arguments.Description: Add stack traces to logging output

Arguments.Name: --stats-module-assets
Arguments.Description: Add information about assets inside modules

Arguments.Name: --stats-module-trace
Arguments.Description: Add dependencies and origin of warnings/errors

Arguments.Name: --stats-modules-sort
Arguments.Description: Sort the modules by that field

Arguments.Name: --stats-modules-space
Arguments.Description: Space to display modules (groups will be collapsed to fit this space, value is in number of modules/groups)

Arguments.Name: --stats-nested-modules
Arguments.Description: Add information about modules nested in other modules (like with module concatenation)

Arguments.Name: --stats-nested-modules-space
Arguments.Description: Space to display modules nested within other modules (groups will be collapsed to fit this space, value is in number of modules/group)

Arguments.Name: --stats-optimization-bailout
Arguments.Description: Show reasons why optimization bailed out for modules

Arguments.Name: --stats-reasons
Arguments.Description: Add information about the reasons why modules are included

Arguments.Name: --stats-reasons-space
Arguments.Description: Space to display reasons (groups will be collapsed to fit this space)

Arguments.Name: --stats-related-assets
Arguments.Description: Add information about assets that are related to other assets (like SourceMaps for assets)

Arguments.Name: --stats-runtime
Arguments.Description: Add information about runtime modules (deprecated: use 'runtimeModules' instead)

Arguments.Name: --stats-source
Arguments.Description: Add the source code of modules

Arguments.Name: --stats-warnings-filter
Arguments.Description: Suppress listing warnings that match the specified filters (they will still be counted). Filters can be Strings, RegExps or Functions

Arguments.Name: --stats-warnings-filter-reset
Arguments.Description: Clear all items provided in 'stats.warningsFilter' configuration. Suppress listing warnings that match the specified filters (they will still be counted). Filters can be Strings, RegExps or Functions

Arguments.Name: --target
Arguments.Description: Sets the build target e.g. node

Arguments.Name: --target-reset
Arguments.Description: Clear all items provided in 'target' configuration. Environment to build for. An array of environments to build for all of them when possible

Arguments.Name: --no-watch
Arguments.Description: Do not watch for file changes

Arguments.Name: --watch-options-aggregate-timeout
Arguments.Description: Delay the rebuilt after the first change. Value is a time in ms

Arguments.Name: --watch-options-follow-symlinks
Arguments.Description: Resolve symlinks and watch symlink and real file. This is usually not needed as webpack already resolves symlinks ('resolve.symlinks')

Arguments.Name: --watch-options-ignored
Arguments.Description: A glob pattern for files that should be ignored from watching. Ignore some files from watching (glob pattern or regexp)

Arguments.Name: --watch-options-ignored-reset
Arguments.Description: Clear all items provided in 'watchOptions.ignored' configuration. Ignore some files from watching (glob pattern or regexp)

Arguments.Name: --watch-options-poll
Arguments.Description: `number`: use polling with specified interval. `true`: use polling

Arguments.Name: --watch-options-stdin
Arguments.Description: Stop watching when stdin stream has ended

Arguments.Name: --no-watch-options-stdin
Arguments.Description: Do not stop watching when stdin stream has ended

Arguments.Name: build
Arguments.Description: Run webpack (default command, can be omitted)

Arguments.Name: config-path
Arguments.Description: Path to the webpack configuration file

Arguments.Name: help
Arguments.Description: Display help for command and options

Arguments.Name: version
Arguments.Description: Display the version number of webpack, webpack-cli, and webpack-dev-server commands

Arguments.Name: watch
Arguments.Description: Run webpack and watch for file changes
